leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算系统生物学与动力学生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: ODE/PDE 模型, 代谢网络, 信号通路, 参数与不确定性
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 建模→参数估计→仿真→敏感性/UQ→反演→验证
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 建模语言/仿真器 + 参数估计/UQ + 数据拟合工作流

unit.unit_name: 敏感性分析与不确定性量化（生物动力学）

queries: [WEB] sensitivity analysis tools systems biology github
[WEB] global sensitivity analysis python library github

tools.name: AMICI
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance interface for ODE/PDE simulation and sensitivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: AMICI provides a multi-language (Python, C++, Matlab) interface for the SUNDIALS solvers CVODES and IDAS. It is designed for efficient simulation and sensitivity analysis of large-scale ordinary differential equation models, particularly in systems biology.

tools.name: PESTO (MATLAB)
tools.one_line_profile: Parameter Estimation Toolbox for systems biology in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: PESTO is a MATLAB toolbox for parameter estimation in dynamical systems, particularly for systems biology. It offers deterministic and stochastic optimization algorithms, along with uncertainty quantification methods like profile likelihood and MCMC sampling.

tools.name: parPE
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel parameter estimation for dynamical models
tools.detailed_description: parPE is a C++ library designed for high-performance parameter estimation of dynamical models. It supports distributed memory parallelization (MPI) to handle large-scale datasets and models, often used in conjunction with AMICI.

tools.name: pyPESTO
tools.one_line_profile: Python Parameter Estimation Toolbox for systems biology
tools.detailed_description: pyPESTO is a widely used Python framework for parameter estimation and uncertainty quantification in dynamical systems. It integrates with simulators like AMICI and supports various optimization methods, profile likelihood analysis, and sampling.

tools.name: PeSTo
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning for protein binding interface prediction
tools.detailed_description: PeSTo (Protein Structure Transformer) is a geometric deep learning method that predicts protein binding interfaces directly from protein structures. It operates on point clouds and is used for inferring protein-protein and protein-ligand interactions.

tools.name: pyvipr
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of systems biology models and interactions
tools.detailed_description: pyvipr is a Jupyter widget for the static and dynamic visualization of systems biology models. It supports models written in PySB, BNGL, and SBML, helping researchers inspect reaction networks and causal relationships.

tools.name: Performance Estimation Toolbox (PESTO)
tools.one_line_profile: Automated worst-case analysis of first-order optimization methods
tools.detailed_description: PESTO is a MATLAB toolbox that automates the performance estimation of first-order optimization methods. It allows researchers to perform worst-case analyses (convergence rates) for convex and nonconvex optimization algorithms using the PEP methodology.

tools.name: SAFE-python
tools.one_line_profile: Global Sensitivity Analysis toolbox for Python
tools.detailed_description: SAFE (Sensitivity Analysis for Everybody) is a Python library that implements various global sensitivity analysis methods (EET, PAWN, VBSA) to assess the influence of input parameters on model outputs.

tools.name: SALib
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive Sensitivity Analysis Library in Python
tools.detailed_description: SALib is the standard Python library for performing global sensitivity analysis. It includes implementations of Sobol, Morris, FAST, and other methods, widely used in systems biology, engineering, and environmental modeling.

tools.name: UQpy
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose Python toolbox for uncertainty quantification
tools.detailed_description: UQpy is a comprehensive Python toolbox for modeling uncertainty in physical and mathematical systems. It provides modules for uncertainty propagation, reliability analysis, stochastic process generation, and inference.

tools.name: GlobalSensitivity.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Global Sensitivity Analysis library for the Julia SciML ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: GlobalSensitivity.jl provides high-performance, parallelized implementations of global sensitivity analysis methods (Sobol, Morris, eFAST, etc.) within the Julia Scientific Machine Learning (SciML) ecosystem.

tools.name: SciMLExpectations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty quantification for differential equations in Julia
tools.detailed_description: SciMLExpectations.jl offers fast methods for computing expectations and uncertainty quantification of observables in systems defined by differential equations, leveraging the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: StructuralIdentifiability.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for structural identifiability analysis of ODE systems
tools.detailed_description: StructuralIdentifiability.jl is a Julia package for assessing the local and global structural identifiability of parameters in ordinary differential equation models, a critical step before parameter estimation in systems biology.

tools.name: StochKit
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible stochastic simulation toolkit for biochemical systems
tools.detailed_description: StochKit is a C++ stochastic simulation toolkit that provides efficient implementations of the Gillespie algorithm (SSA) and its variants (Tau-leaping) for simulating biochemical reaction networks.

tools.name: Cerebrum
tools.one_line_profile: Biologically plausible neural network simulation framework for brain dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for simulating brain dynamics and inferring connectivity using biologically plausible neural networks, designed for computational neuroscience research.

tools.name: COPASI
tools.one_line_profile: Software application for simulation and analysis of biochemical networks
tools.detailed_description: COPASI is a comprehensive software application for the simulation and analysis of biochemical networks and their dynamics. It supports ODEs, stochastic simulation, and various analysis methods like sensitivity analysis and parameter estimation.

tools.name: basico
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified Python interface to COPASI
tools.detailed_description: A simplified Python interface to COPASI, allowing users to create, simulate, and analyze biochemical models using COPASI's backend directly from Python.

tools.name: sensitivity
tools.one_line_profile: Global Sensitivity Analysis of Model Outputs (R package)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of functions for global sensitivity analysis of model outputs, including Morris, Sobol, and FAST methods. This is a mirror of the standard CRAN package.

tools.name: AgentPy
tools.one_line_profile: Agent-based modeling framework in Python
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for the development, simulation, and analysis of agent-based models (ABM) in Python, suitable for complex adaptive systems.

tools.name: GlobalSensitivityAnalysis.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Global sensitivity analysis methods for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package implementing various global sensitivity analysis methods, including Sobol, Morris, and eFAST, designed for analyzing model parameter influence.

tools.name: sbinn
tools.one_line_profile: Systems-biology-informed neural networks for parameter identification
tools.detailed_description: A framework for identifiability analysis and parameter identification in systems biology models using physics-informed neural networks (PINNs).

tools.name: protein-uq
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking uncertainty quantification methods on proteins
tools.detailed_description: A repository for benchmarking and evaluating uncertainty quantification (UQ) methods specifically applied to protein engineering and modeling tasks.

tools.name: wassa
tools.one_line_profile: WebAssembly implementation of the Stochastic Simulation Algorithm for biological systems
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements the Stochastic Simulation Algorithm (SSA) compiled to WebAssembly, enabling high-performance stochastic modeling of chemical reaction networks and biological systems directly in web environments.

tools.name: SIAN
tools.one_line_profile: Software for assessing structural identifiability of ODE models
tools.detailed_description: SIAN (Structural Identifiability ANalyser) is a tool designed to check the structural identifiability of parameters in ordinary differential equation (ODE) models, helping researchers determine if model parameters can be uniquely estimated from data.

tools.name: Tellurium
tools.one_line_profile: Python environment for modeling and simulating biological systems
tools.detailed_description: Tellurium is a Python-based environment for systems biology modeling, supporting SBML models and providing high-performance simulation capabilities via libRoadRunner. It integrates model editing, simulation, and analysis into a unified workflow.

tools.name: VARS-TOOL
tools.one_line_profile: Sensitivity analysis package based on Variogram Analysis of Response Surfaces
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing the VARS (Variogram Analysis of Response Surfaces) framework for global sensitivity analysis, designed to handle high-dimensional and computationally expensive models efficiently.
